If the bevior reported in bug 172175 (i.e. StyledText.getSelection() returns insertion offset and not actual selection) is the expected/designed one then I can workaround this bug using getSelection().

I believe this is the expected behaviour as documented: * @exception IllegalArgumentException
    *
  • ERROR_NULL_ARGUMENT when point is null
    • *
  • ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT when there is no character at the specified location
    • If the mouse position is beyond the styled text area, you will get this error. For example, this will occur when you move the mouse beyond the last character in the styled text. The (caret) insertion point will be set to the last character but if you call st.getOffsetAtLocation(location) then you will get the exception. I believe you want to call styledText.getCaretOffset() during the drop if you need the current offset where the insertion is going to occur.
No idea what was wrong yesterday with my workspace. Today it works like a charm.
